questions.question: I will take this job ....................... the salary is not too low.
I will be back in the evening ......................... there is a bus strike.
Let's go for a walk - .............................. you are too tired.
I am going to work in the garden this afternoon ................. it rains.
........................... you don't mend your ways, you will land in trouble.
I won't be able to go ................. you come with me.
............................ you don't stop the music, I will call the police.
questions.description: If not means the same as unless.

questions.question: The taxmen will get you ........................ you don't pay the tax.
questions.description: If not means the same as unless.

questions.question: ............................... you try, you will never win.
questions.description: The above sentence can also be written as: If you don't try, you will never win.

questions.question: ................................ you don't pay up, you will be in trouble.
questions.description: The above sentence can also be written as: Unless you pay up, you will be in trouble.

questions.question: ............................... she is late again, she will be shown the door.
questions.description: Unless is not possible here because it means if not.
